contentrichtext.text: '''Q with hook tail''' (majuscule: '''{{Unicode|Ɋ}}''', minuscule: '''{{Unicode|ɋ}}''') is a letter of the extended [[Latin alphabet]], based on the letter [[Q]]. It was introduced by [[Lutheran]] [[missionaries]] in [[Papua New Guinea]] for use in the [[Numanggang language]] in the 1930s or 1940s. In 2002, it was decided to discontinue using Q with hook tail.<ref name="N2906"/> In some forms of handwriting for English (and presumably other languages based on the [[Latin alphabet]]), lowercase q ''always'' has a hook tail. This is particularly evident in [[geometric sans-serif]] typefaces used to teach children how to write. ==Unicode== {{charmap |024A|name1=LATIN CAPITAL LETTER<br />SMALL Q WITH HOOK TAIL |024B|name2=LATIN SMALL LETTER<br />Q WITH HOOK TAIL }} == References == <references> <ref name="N2906">[http://std.dkuug.dk/jtc1/sc2/wg2/docs/n2906.pdf Revised Proposal for Additional Latin Phonetic and Orthographic Characters], Lorna A. Priest, 2004. </references> {{Latin alphabet|Q|}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Q With Hook Tail}} [[Category:Uncommon Latin letters|Qz]] {{Latin-alphabet-stub}} {{writingsystem-stub}}
